title: Authorities: Teen shooting victim in Paterson accidentally shot himself
content:
The Record and Paterson Press
PATERSON — A 16-year-old boy who said he was shot Saturday night in Paterson apparently fired the shots himself, Paterson Police said Sunday.
The teenager, who suffered a gunshot wound to his upper leg, told police that as he was walking home near East Main and Bergen streets, a man jumped out of a car, fired a gun at him and fled in the vehicle.
Police investigated the incident and concluded that the teenager’s injuries were a result of an accident that occurred when the boy was handling the firearm, Police Director Jerry Speziale said.
As of Sunday, the teenager was being held at a detention center in Essex County. He will be charged with weapons offenses, police said.
"The investigators did a phenomenal job in determining the cause in this investigation," Speziale said. “Anyone involved with illegal firearms will be charged accordingly. The Paterson Police Department takes this seriously and will not be fooled by anyone.”
